items.title: withQRCode
items.content_html:
For any website, prepend withQRCode.com/ in the URL and you’ll have a QRCode for that link.

Actually inQRCode.com works too.

And you can use like this: makzan.net.inQRCode.com if it is a domain without slash.
items.content_text: For any website, prepend withQRCode.com/ in the URL and you’ll have a QRCode for that link. Actually inQRCode.com works too. And you can use like this: makzan.net.inQRCode.com if it is a domain without slash.

items.content_html:
Quote from WHATWG.

html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage…

The WHATWG was based on several core principles, in particular that technologies need to be backwards compatible, that specifications and implementations need to match even if this means changing the specification rather than the implementations, and that specifications need to be detailed enough that implementations can achieve complete interoperability without reverse-engineering each other.
items.content_text:
Quote from WHATWG. [html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage...](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/introduction.html#history-2)
The WHATWG was based on several core principles, in particular that technologies need to be backwards compatible, that specifications and implementations need to match even if this means changing the specification rather than the implementations, and that specifications need to be detailed enough that implementations can achieve complete interoperability without reverse-engineering each other.

items.title: Simple is actually the natural state of things
items.content_html:
I believe simple is actually the natural state of things. It’s simple until you make it complicated. This goes for just about anything in life and work.
—Jason Fried, From: How we put together a simple deal to spin off Know Your Company

items.content_html:
Reading: CSS Link in body.

You need to take care when using layout systems where content dictates layout (such as tables & flexbox) to avoid content-shifting during load. This isn't a new problem, but progressive rendering can expose it more frequently. You can hack flexbox to behave, but CSS grid is a much better system for overall page layout (flexbox is still great for smaller components).
items.content_text:
Reading: CSS Link in body.

You need to take care when using layout systems where content dictates layout (such as tables & flexbox) to avoid content-shifting during load. This isn't a new problem, but progressive rendering can expose it more frequently. You can hack flexbox to behave, but CSS grid is a much better system for overall page layout (flexbox is still great for smaller components).

Clip down for reference. “asynchronous most of the time, context all the time”.

Our secret to working sustainably at Basecamp: Real-time sometimes,
asynchronous most of the time, context all the time.

— Jason Fried (@jasonfried) February 5, 2016

items.title: And I can post #tag...
items.content_html: And I can post #tag here. So it will be my public steam that I #tag different projects, showing the progress of my projects.
items.content_text: And I can post #tag here. So it will be my public steam that I #tag different projects, showing the progress of my projects.

items.content_html: I’m building this live stream so that I can post what I’m working on. And thus the behind-the-scene of my projects.
